column4: Completely lost, Just got an Acer Aspire 5570, wireless does not work. My wireless card is an, Intel PRO/Wireless 3945ABG, I've tried the documentation... but I'm lost. Any help?
What chipset? Or is that the chipset?
Literally just bought the laptop, where would I find the chipset information?
Let me google it. IDK if lspci would work or not.
I found something on Google.
Let me find something specific to Ubuntu.
I hope that you are able to, I've been trying to make this work for 3 hrs =(
What happens when you sudo modprobe ipw3945 ?
Ahh.
Do you have it turned on? (Function Key + Wi-fi button usually)
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=187747 That is a thread I found which might give you some insights.
What would the WiFi key look like?
It's the button to turn on the wi-fi adapter. I'd have to look at a digital camera picture of the keyboard to tell you.
Did you find it?
Hello?
Was able to turn on the wireless card, so when I run a sudo modprobe ipw3945 i no longer get the error message... any thoughts from here?
Glad you responded. Now try playing with the network manager.
It's the icon that is by the clock.
The only things that I see in there are for the 'Wired connection' and 'Manual Configuration' in the Manual configuration, it only has my wired card and a modem, nothing about my wireless card
Let me look some more.
I really appreciate he help
No clue at this point.
Alrighty, well I really appreciate the help. Who would have known that you had to turn it on... lol, thanks anyhow.
Maybe try a reboot. You're welcome
